meanings.definition: To tie or fasten together with knots.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys interknotting colorful ribbons to make bracelets.
meanings.sent2: The sailor was interknotting the ropes to secure the boat.
meanings.sent3: The children were interknotting their shoelaces in a playful race.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to interknot her heart with invisible threads of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The spider was interknotting its web with precision and skill.

meanings.sent1: The vines interknotting in the jungle created a natural barrier.
meanings.sent2: Her hair started interknotting after a long day in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The wires interknotting behind the TV made it hard to figure out the connections.
meanings.sent4: The plot of the mystery novel began to interknot, leaving readers guessing.
meanings.sent5: The threads interknotting in the fabric formed a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: The act of connecting or linking together through knots.
meanings.sent1: The interknotting of the ropes was essential for the safety of the climbers.
meanings.sent2: She studied the art of interknotting to create intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The interknotting of the friendship bracelets symbolized their bond.
meanings.sent4: The interknotting of the branches created a natural canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The interknotting of the threads in the tapestry told a story of unity.
